RE: License#: CB380201116
Dear Mr. Powell:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 6/7/23. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective action
plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and
must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12212 Personnel Records
(2) The personnel record shall contain all of the
following information before employment may occur:
(d) Three references obtained from persons who are
unrelated to the staff person.
One of four employee files was missing documentation for a reference.
CPA Rule 400.12421 Visitation and parenting time
(1) An agency shall have a policy regarding visitation
and parenting time that contains, at a minimum, all of
the following:
(b) An agency social service worker shall visit the
foster child and the foster parent in the foster parent’s
home at least once every month.
One of three foster care files did not have a foster home visit documented for the
month of September 2022. The agency completed visits as required by
contract/DHHS policy. However, policy does not align with licensing rules.

CPA Rule 400.12605 Adoptive family evaluation
(1) An agency social service worker shall complete a
written adoptive evaluation within 90 days of the family
signing an adoption application and prior to approving a
family for adoption.
One of three adoption assessments was not completed within 90 days as
required.

IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Adoptive Family Assessments- The agency was advised that an evaluation
must be completed within 90 days of application. However, a
recommendation could be completed after the fact, via an addendum, should
the agency not have enough information to make a recommendation at the
90-day mark.
• Foster Home visits- the agency was cited for a missing monthly foster home
visit. The agency reported they were focusing on compliance with their
contract requirement to have face to face contact with the child. However,
they overlooked that licensing rules require monthly visits in the foster home
with the child. The agency is now aware that both the contract and rule must
be followed regarding visits.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following area:

• Policies & Procedures- As it is anticipated the new foster home and CPA
licensing rules will go into effect in 2023, the agency was offered consultation
as they review and adjust their current policies and procedures to align with
the new rules. Consultation will be ongoing.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows. During this review,
the agency reduced their number of violations significantly. In the 7/12/22 interim
review (CAP approved 7/28/22) the agency had 14 violations. During this renewal
review, the agency had 4 violations. Although two of the citations are repeat
violations, the number of files which were affected decreased. Overall, the agency
has shown significant compliance with the 2022 Interim CAP.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) was reviewed and discussed on-site.
The CAA indicated the agency was in substantial compliance with the 2022
Corrective Action Plan. The Chief Administrator reported the agency is currently
fully staffed, which has helped increase compliance in several areas. Specifically
visits and medical/dental appointments. The agency had two unplanned
placement disruptions. Both involving a sibling group with significant behavioral
needs, which were initially unknown when they came in to care. The agency
continues to provide support to the children and foster parents.
Financial Overview
The agency's most recent financial evaluation and 2023 budget were reviewed.
There were no concerns regarding the agency's financial stability.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff reported being happy in their
positions at the agency. Staff stated their supervisors are knowledgeable and
supportive. Staff enjoy having a flexible schedule and positive relationship with co-
workers. Neither staff had any concerns or suggestion for improvements at the
agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in an office building in downtown Jackson. The building has
adequate locking storage for files. The agency has sufficient space for staff to

work, and clients to have family visits. No concerns were noted regarding the
facility
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
